item.title: F# Publications | The F# Software Foundation
item.description: F# is about clarity of thinking and expression - ‚Äúcomputational thinking made manifest‚Äù - and is loved by academics and researchers for bringing clear, concise problem solving techniques developed in academia into practice. F# is both based on academic research and acts as an inspiration for thousands of students and researchers worldwide. Many standard F# features (including active patterns and asynchronous workflows) have been described in academic literature, and many research projects build on top of F#.

item.title: BlazorWebinarWithCarl
item.description:
Having completed the first leg of the Blazor Roadshow, it's now time to answer some common questions surrounding Microsoft's latest offering.
Join DevExpress CTO Julian Bucknall and Technical Evangelist Paul Usher as they chat with Carl Franklin about all things Blazor.
In this presentation you'll learn the difference between client and server side models, how to incorporate DevExpress Blazor components within your project, and see why the Blazor framework is a game changer for developers. You‚Äôll also have the opportunity to submit your questions and have them answered in our extended Q&A session.

item.title: Tip 253 - Use Ingress Controller to access resources in an Azure Virtual Network
item.description: In a recent customer engagement, they wanted to access all the AKS services via an Azure virtual network. This customer's application is not an external facing and needs to be on a corporate network to access their resources (e.g. HR, payroll,procurement etc..) If you are familiar with the Kubernetes eco system, we can use NGINX ingress controller to expose Kubernetes services on an external IP address. Azure Kubernetes Services comes to the rescue. AKS provides an option to deploy your NGINX ingress controller on an internal network which keeps the resources accessible only on an internal network and can be accessible via Express Route or VPN.

item.title: Getting started with Contoso Crafts
item.description:
Contoso Crafts is a sample application that was created to help how the fundamental concepts behind creating a application with ASP.NET. In this episode, Brady Gaster sits with Christos to discuss the motivations behind the project. If you're hosting an introductory workshop or just getting started with ASP.NET Core, this is a great place for you to start.
* [01:28] - What is Contoso Crafts? * [06:00] - Exploring the code of Contoso Crafts * [08:38 ]- Exploring the website
